intro: Oubanguia klainei, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their milky sap. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its latex, which is milky and toxic, has been used traditionally for various purposes. Oubanguia klainei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has ecological significance in its native habitat.
